newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian bullion closes higher on world recovery.
newsitem.headline: Indian bullion closes higher on world recovery.

text.p: ** Gold 24 carat closed 5 rupees higher at 4,770 rupees per 10 gramme against the previous close of 4,765 rupees amid limited arrivals and a modest recovery in the world market while seasonal buying remained slow. Gold was down by 5 rupees per 10 gramme on Saturday.
** Prices of gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) closed 100 rupees higher at 55,800 rupees per piece after losing 100 rupees on Saturday.
** Silver (.999) closed 10 rupees higher at 6,885 rupees per kg against the previous close of 6,875 as a recovery in the world market and limited inflow prompted speculative support.

Gold 24 carat closed 5 rupees higher at 4,770 rupees per 10 gramme against the previous close of 4,765 rupees amid limited inflow while a modest recovery in the world market prompted speculative interest on Monday, dealers said.
Seasonal buying however remained slow. Gold was down by 5 rupees per 10 gramme on Saturday and by 25 rupees last week.
Prices of a gold biscuit (116.50 gramme) closed 100 rupees higher at 55,800 rupees per piece after losing 100 rupees on Saturday. They were down by 300 rupees last week.

Silver (.999) closed 10 rupees higher at 6,885 rupees per kg against the previous close of 6,875 rupees as limited arrivals and a modest rally in the world market helped local prices to extend gains. Silver was up by 55 rupees per kg on Saturday.
Overall market sentiments remained sudued at the close amid poor physical enquiries while inflow was at a low ebb. (Conversion $1=35.78 rupees)
